content.description: Charge up some undulating rock that makes for some awkward movements. Get to a stance and the last bolt. From here, it is easy 5.8 to the anchors but a bit run out. If you traverse up and right, you could get a small piece in before traversing back left to the anchors.
content.protection: QDs, a finger-size piece is optional.
content.location: It is on the right side of the large ledge.

content.description: This has some great, solid stone. It can be combined with one of the lower pitches on the left for one mega pitch! From the ledge and bolted anchor, follow the line of bolts up a seam and to a slight bulge. Piece together the technical crux, and it's casual fun climbing to the anchors.
content.location: It is the left route from the ledge up the pale colored rock.

content.description: Begin on some dark featured rock past a few cacti to get some gear in and trend up the black rock towards a bolt. Clip a second bolt trending left towards obvious big features on light colored rock. Do a good-ol-fashioned mantle to clip the 3rd bolt. One tricky slab moves guards the rounded ledge where you can get a small piece in. Traverse left 10' and go up the right angling crack to the large ledge.
content.protection: Small gear with a few medium pieced, Nuts. QDs. Bolted Double ring anchors at top
content.location: 10' Left of the Start of Dark Blue. Look for some broken rock and a cactus.

content.description: This route has some great movement over good stone. The first bolt is a little high, but getting there is relatively easy. The crux comes after moving past and over the large roof/flake where you clip a few bolts and set off on some slabby terrain. The upper 1/4 of the route is easy and fun face climbing with some pro where you need it.
content.protection: QDs, a single set from small cams to 0.75, and nuts. Newly replaced anchors are at the far end of the obvious ledge to the left of the shrubberies.
content.location: This is the first route you come across in Zone 2. Look for the obvious flake/roof with bolts below and  above it. This is the red route on the topo for Zone 2.

content.description:
More technical slab climbing gets you to a slight rib which you follow to gain the eyebrow which trends right. Continue past a shrub ledge and finish as for

Green

.
content.location:
This is the furthest bolt line left of the slab. Hike a bit up the hill to start. It is 30' up canyon from

Light Green

.

content.description:
This route is a bit of a squeeze job as it is very close to the

Green

route; however, it does take advantage of the good stone in the small area. Very technical slab climbing with balance and difficult clips lead you past the first half to where it meets with

Green

route at the left-trending eyebrow. At least it is well bolted! Continue up the same finish as

Green

.
content.location:
Start is 10' to the left of

Green

route up the obvious, blank slab.

content.description:
This is another variation to

Fuchsia

. Take the left bolt from the ledge to gain a sloping ledge. From here, it is either a healthy run out on some difficult terrain to the shared anchor, or you can traverse left on the small ledge to meet up with the end of

Turquoise

.
content.protection:
Same as for

Dark Blue

. It uses the same anchor as

Red

.
content.location:
Its start is the same as for

Dark Blue

.

content.description: This is probably one of the best slab routes in Unaweep. Well bolted with some awesome features. The rock is very good. Several mantels and presses takes you through the low angle slick rock of the bottom. Gun for the left arcing eyebrow where you can clip a head and/or place some small gear. Continue until the eyebrow peak and terminates. Move left and up the broken terrain via the path of least resistance.  Joint a corner for 20' to the top.
content.protection:
Small gear to .5, nuts, QDs

same anchors as Torquoise
content.location: the start is 20' left of Torquoise and begins from atop a sharp tooth at the bottom of the wall.

content.description:
This is the easiest route on the wall and is a good warm up. Start up the fractured cracks through some good climbing to gain a ledge and some dark rocks. Trend towards the single bolt that is furthest right of the three options from the ledge.  Clip the bolt and move straight up on face to either gain a shallow corner of continue up the last 1/4 of the

Red route

to the share anchors.
content.location:
This route is just passed the short, right-facing dihedral. Begin up the face to the right of the dihedral's edge. It uses the same anchors as

Red

. It is fuschia on the topo.

content.description:
This is a variation to the top half of

Fuchsia

. Instead of clipping the sole right hand bolt, continue straight up past two bolts, the crux appearing on the light colored granite. Gain the shallow dihedral, and it's easy ground to the shared anchor.
content.protection: QD's Small gear, #.75, 3. Nuts. Shares anchors with Red.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Fuchsia

.
